src_text: Phethagat o ya Mananeo a Bohlokwa a Mmu o Bjale ka mmu o re ikgafile kudu go kaonafat a maphelo a batho ba rena, ke ka lebaka leo thuto e t welago pele go ba ye nngwe ya dilo t a rena t e bohlokwa t e di tlago pel Re bont hit e se ka go aba methopo, fao Thuto le Tlhahlo t a Godingwana e bilego ye nngwe ya baholego ba bagolo ka ditekanyet ong t a boset haba t a ngwaga wo, gomme yona ya hwet a tlalelet o ya 18% mo ngwageng wa dit helete wa 2016/17.Le ge go na le mathata a ekonomi re t wela pele go aba methopo bjalo ka taet o ya thekgo ya rena ya go katolo a phihlelelo go Thuto ya Godingwana, le go thuto ka kakaret
trg_text: Implementation of key government programmes As government we are deeply committed to the upliftment of our people, hence education remains one of our apex prioritie We have demonstrated this through the allocation of resources, where Higher Education and Training was one of the biggest beneficiaries of this year s national budget, receiving an additional 18% for 2016/17.Despite economic difficulties we continue allocating resources as a demonstration of our support to broaden access to Higher Education, and education in genera Government this year provided Rbillion of the Rbillion shortfall resulting from the subsidisation on the 2016 increas More than Rbillion has been reprioritized in the 2016/17 financial year to make it available to the National Student Financial Aid Scheme to enable poor students to access higher educatio Government is fully aware that an investment in the education of our children will contribute to a higher trajectory of economic growth, which is needed to address the triple challenges of unemployment, poverty and inequalitGovernment has heard and responded to the pleas of students and will subsidise the fee adjustments for poor working and middle class university students for the 2017 academic yea Students whose parents or guardians can afford to pay for a university education must and should continue to do so, because education is a responsibility of all not only governmen The adjustment takes into account the issue of affordability for students and their parents, as well as the need to ensure that institutions of higher learning remain financially viabl The interim report by the Council on Higher Education proposed an inflation-linked fee adjustment across the board for 2014.

src_text: Mmu o mo ngwageng wo o abile Rpilione ya tlhaelelo ya Rpilione ye e bakilwego ke thekgo ya ma eleng ya koket ego ya dit helete t a dithuto ka 2016.
trg_text: Cabinet congratulates Brad Binder for his historic Moto3 World Championship wi The 21-year-old motorcycle racer became the first South African since 1980 to clinch a Grand Prix title after winning his maiden Moto3 championshi.

src_text: T helete ye e fetago Rpilione e abilwe leswa ka ngwageng wa dit helete wa 2016/17 gore e hwet we ke Setlamo sa Boset haba sa Thu o ya Dit helete t a Baithuti (NSFAS) ka nepo ya go kgont ha baithuti bao ba hlokago go fihlelela thuto ya godingwan Mmu o o tloga o tseba gabotse gore peelet o ka go thuto ya bana ba rena e tla tsenya letsogo go phihlelelo ya godimo ya kgolo ya ekonomi, ye e nyakegago go rarolla ditlhohlo t e tharo t a tlhokego ya me omo, bohloki le tlhokego ya tekatekanMmu o o kwele gomme wa fetola boipilet o bja baithuti gomme o tla thekga tlhatlo o ya dit helete t a dithuto go baithuti bao ba t wago malapeng a ba omi bao ba hlokago le ba legoro la magareng mo ngwageng wa dithuto wa 2017.
trg_text: action plan South Africa also prioritised legislative openness, open data, and broadening civil society participation to include grass root organisation and vulnerable groups within the OGP Key Cabinet decisions Cabinet was briefed on the assessment by the Academy of Science of South Africa on South Africa s technical readiness to support the shale gas industry, including the recommendations on actions to be implemented by relevant department In the transition to low carbon technologies while improving energy security, South Africa is considering shale gas as a potential contributor to the country s future energy miThe report, which will be released for public consumption, raises a number of issues that require attention in order to bring the country to a full state of readines These include: strengthening the regulatory, licensing and monitoring authorities, ensuring that South Africa has the requisite skills; supporting relevant companies to exploit the economic opportunities, putting in place measures that will protect natural resources, and commencing with researc The report will be used as the basis to develop the shale gas research, development and innovation pla Progress has been made on Operation Phakisa for Agriculture, Land Reform and Rural Developmen Through Operation Phakisa government seeks to expand growth, with the view to make South Africa a food secure nation at all levelSince May 2016, extensive consultation sessions were conducted over a four-month perio The actual LAB is taking place over a five-week period from 25 September and 28 October 2016.

trg_text: Cabinet appeals to students and student leaders in particular, to raise their concerns appropriately according to the Constitution, which guides all South African Recent violence marred student protests when the country witnessed vandalism, destruction of property, burning of libraries and now even the death of a university worke President Jacob Zuma has instructed the Justice, Crime Prevention and Security Cluster (JCPS) to deal with the mayhem that is destroying our institutions of higher learnin The President will be meeting with the Ministers from the JCPS Cluster later toda Law-enforcement agencies, who are acting within the confines of the law, will leave no stone unturned in finding those responsible for the criminal activities witnesse In welcoming the announcement by the Department of Basic Education that it is all systems go for the 2016 Grade 12 National Senior Certificate examination, we urge all stakeholders to work together to ensure that our institutions of higher learning are in a position to receive the Class of 2016 in order to secure a brighter future for our childre All stakeholders, especially parents and guardians, need to be actively involved in finding lasting solutions to the education funding challengThe Grade 12 examinations run from 26 October to 29 November 2016.

trg_text: The commission was established by the UN Secretary-General and it aims to engage leaders at the highest level to encourage the creation of new employment opportunities in the health sector globall The Report of the Commission which was adopted by the General Assembly, makes recommendations to Member States, ranging from training needs, continuing education and the need to focus on primary health car This includes a commitment to train 40 million health workers by 2030.The official handover of the Open Government Partnership (OGP) leader chair position to France was done by President Zuma during the five-year anniversary event on the margins of the UNG During South Africa s tenure as chair of the OGP we championed the Open Government Declaration on the implementation of the 2030 Agenda for Sustainable Development, which will see OGP member countries incorporating Sustainable Development Goals in their OGP countries

src_text: oma mmogo go netefat a gore dihlongwa t a rena t a thuto ya godingwana di seemong sa go kgona go amogela baithuti ba Marematlou ba ngwaga wa 2016 ka nepo ya go netefat a gore bana ba rena ba hwet a bokamoso bjo bokaon Bakgathatema ka moka, kudukudu batswadi le bahlokomedi ba baithuti, ba swanet e go kgatha tema ka mafolofolo ka nepo ya go hwet a ditharollo t a sa ruri go bothata bja thu o ya dit helete t a thutDitlhahlobo t a Kreiti ya 12 di thoma go ngwalwa ka la 26 Diphalane go fihla ka la 29 Dibatsela 2016.
trg_text: on 2 October 2016 at the Fountains Valley Resort, Pretori Cabinet encourages South Africans to embrace an active, healthier lifestyle so as to tackle the high incidence of lifestyle diseases and obesit 19 October 2016 marks the 30th anniversary of the plane crash that claimed the life of Mozambican President, Samora Moises Machel and 34 of his country men and women, including pilots and journalistThe people of Mozambique contributed towards the liberation of South Africa and other countries in the subcontinen The government of the Republic of South Africa, in collaboration with the government of the Republic of Mozambique, will host the 30th anniversary commemorations at the crash site in Mbuzini, Mpumalanga on 17 October 2016.This contributes to the Department of Arts and Culture establishing a resistance and liberation heritage route that will link all liberation heritage route sites in South Africa, the SADC and the continenCabinet extends condolences to the following: The family and friends of South African music legend and one of the pioneers of Kwaito music genre, Mduduzi Tshabalala, popularly known as Mandoz His music achieved a unique cultural crossover which continues to be appreciated by all South African.

src_text: Tona ya Thuto ya Motheo o tla tsebi a dipoelo t a ditlhahlobo t a Kreiti ya 12 t a 2016 ka la 4 Pherekgong 2017.
trg_text: The Minister of Basic Education will announce the outcome of the 2016 Grade 12 exams on 4 January 2017.

src_text: Ka ditlhahlobong t a 2016, go na le baithuti ba 677 141 ba dinako ka moka le ba 150 183 ba dinako t e it ego, e lego palo ya baithuti bao ba fetilego bao ba ngwadilego ditlhahlobo ka ngwaga wa 2015 ka ba 9 000, se se laet a boikgafo bja mmu o bja go netefat a gore bont i bja bafsa ba rena ba phetha dithuto t a bona t a motheo gore ba kgone go kgatha tema ka ekonomin Kabinete e lakalet a baithuti ba Marematlou ba ngwaga wa 2016 mahlatse le mahlogonolo ge ba tsena kgatong ya mafelelo ya mo omo wa bona wa go tsena sekol Ka ge lefase le keteka Let at i la Lefase la Baruti i ka la 5 Diphalane 2016, Kabinete e reta baruti i ba rena ka moka ebile e ba lebogi a ka boikgafo le ka mo omo wa bona wo ba o
trg_text: For the 2016 examinations, there are 677 141 full-time and 150 183 part-time candidates, which is 9 000 more candidates than in 2015, demonstrating government s commitment to ensuring that more of our young people complete their basic education so that they are able to participate in the econom Cabinet wishes the Class of 2016 well as they embark on the final phase of their school career As the world commemorates World Teachers

src_text: omago ka maatla ka go thea motheo wa baetapele ba rena ba ka mos Boikgafo le kgotlelelo ya baruti i ba rena di hlatlo it e batho ba rena ebile di t wela pele go i a bana ba rena bokamosong bjo bokaonEkonomi Kabinete e hlohlelet wa ke dipoelo t a theri ano ye e t welago pele gareng ga mmu o le baetapele ba dikgwebo ye e etilwego pele ke Mopresidente Zuma ka go diri a Lesolo la Mopresidente la Bahlankedibagolophethi i (di-CEO) go aga boitshepo ka ekonoming, go hlohlelet a leswa kgolo ya ekonomi le go efoga go theo wa go lenaneo la kelo ya dikoloto la ka nagenKgatelopele ye e akaret a lenaneo la go thwala bafsa ka nepo ya go tsenya bafsa ba milione o tee ka go mananeo a boithutelame omo ao a lefago mo mengwageng ye meraro ka lefapheng la phraebete, go akaret wa go hlongwa ga Sekhwama sa Dikgwebopotlana le Dikgwebo t a magareng ka R1,5 pilione yeo e tlago beelet wa ka go dikgwebopotlan Go sepelelana le Leano la Dintlha t e Senyane la mmu o, mo omo o dirilwe go sekaseka mafapha a seswai a ekonomi le go tseba Makala ao a ka diri wago go peelet o le kgolo ye mpshGe re t wela pele ba kgwebo ba tlo diri ana mmogo le mmu o ka go diri a diprot eke t e di latelago: go hlongwa ga Sekhwama sa Kgodi o ya Temo; bokgoni bja go thekga papat o ya t a boeti; go oket a palo ya baoki bao ba hlahlilwego; le go tso olo a mafelo a diintasteri ao a phuhlamago, kudukudu ka Vaal Triangl.
trg_text: Day on 5 October 2016, Cabinet applauds all our teachers and commends them for their dedication and hard work in laying the foundation for our future leader The dedication and resilience of our teachers has uplifted our people and continues to propel our children to a brighter futurThe Economy Cabinet is encouraged by the outcomes of the continued engagement between government and captains of industry led by President Zuma through the Presidential CEO Initiative to build confidence in the economy, reignite economic growth and avert a sovereign credit rating downgradProgress includes a youth employment programme to place one million youth in paid internships over three years in the private sector, including the establishment of a South African Small and Medium Enterprise Fund with R1,5 billion to invest in small enterprise In line with government's Nine-Point Plan, work has also been done to analyse eight economic sectors and identify areas for new investment and growtGoing forward business will partner with government through the following projects: establishment of an Agricultural Growth Fund; capacity to support tourism marketing; increasing the numbers of nurses trained; and the revitalisation of declining industrial areas, specifically in the Vaal Triangl.

src_text: Go bile gape le kgatelopele ka go tsenya tiri ong ga Leano la Boset haba la Thabollo le Boitlhamelo ka ga Ditheknolot i t a Haetrot ene le Disele t a Makhura (leo le tsebagalago ka lebitso la HySA Strategy).
trg_text: Progress has also been made in implementing the National Hydrogen and Fuel Cell Technologies Research, Development and Innovation Strategy (HySA Strategy).

src_text: Kabinete e dumelet e HySA Strategy ka 2007 go hloma tsebo le go kgont ha tlhabollo ya dit welet wa t a boleng bja godimo t a kgwebo ka lefapheng la theknolot i ya Haetrot ene le Disele t a Makhura ka go hlweki a methopo ya dimetale ya ka sehlopheng sa pholathinam Se gape se na le bokgoni bja go t wet a pele go t welet a dilo ka nageng ka nepo ya go maatlafat a bahlomi ba diintasteri ba bathobas Boitlhamelo bjo bja Afrika Borwa bo mabapi le go tsenya letsogo ka go boitlhamelo bja bodit habat haba ka go diri a kgwebo ya theknolot i mola ka go le lengwe re hwet a 25% ya mmaraka wa Haetrot ene le wa Disele t a Makhura, wo o fihlago go R pilione ka 20211.
trg_text: Cabinet approved the HySA Strategy in 2007 to create knowledge and enable the development of high-value commercial products in the Hydrogen and Fuel Cell technology sector through beneficiation of the country s platinum group metal resource This also holds the potential to advance localisation with a view to strengthen black industrialist This South African innovation involves contributing to international innovation through technology commercialisation while capturing 25% of the Hydrogen and Fuel Cell market, which translates to R billion in 20211.

src_text: Kabinete e dumelet e go tsebagat wa ga melao ye meswa ye e laolago kamano gareng ga mongmo omo le mo omi mabapi le go dira kgwebo le Mmu
trg_text: Mr Skhumbuzo Dennis Macozoma as the CEO of the South African Roads Agency SOC Limite.

src_text: Melao ye e ngwadilwego ka kuranteng ya mmu o e tsenya tiri ong Molao wa Taolo ya Tshepedit o ya Set haba, wa 2014 (Molao wa bo 11 wa 2014).. Go abela semmu o ga dintlo t a mathomo t e 500 ka Prot ekeng ye e Kopant wego ya Madulo a Batho ka Savanna City, fao go bego go etilwe pele ke Tona ya Madulo a Batho, Mohumagadi Lindiwe Sisulu, ke karolo ya lesolo la mmu o la go aba dintlo t e kaone go batho bao ba hlokago le go thu a go bu et a seriti sa bona ka go netefat a gore ba ipshina ka tokelo ya go hwet a madulo a maleba le a bolen Palomoka ya dintlo t e 200 e ile ya fiwa bagale ba ma ol Ge e fedile mo mengwageng ye e tlago ye mehlano, prot eke ye e tla be e agile dintlo t e di fetago t e 18 000, t eo go t ona t e 500 di tlago abela bagale ba ma ol.
trg_text: The handover of the first 500 houses at the Savanna City Integrated Human Settlements Project, which was led by the Minister of Human Settlements, Ms Lindiwe Sisulu, is part of government s efforts in providing decent housing to needy people and to help restore their dignity by ensuring that they enjoy the right to adequate and quality shelte A total of 200 houses were handed over to military veteran When completed in the next five years, the project will have over 18 000 houses, 500 of which will be allocated to military veteran.

src_text: Seboka sa Pu o ya Inthanete sa Afrika (AfIGF) le Lefelo la Neelano ya Inthanete la Dinaga t e di Hlabologago t a Borwa bja Afrika di tsebagadit we semmu o ka katlego ke Tona ya Kgoro ya Mananeokgoparara a Dikgokaganyo le Ditirelo t a Poso, Ngaka Siyabonga Cwele le Mokhomi enare wa Mokgatlo wa Setee sa Afrika (AU) Ngaka Elham IbrahiAfIGF e t weledit e maemo a ka nageng, ge e itoki et a go tsenela Kopano ya Bohlano ya AfIGF go tloga ka la 16 go fihla ka la 18 Diphalane 2016, ka Durban, KwaZulu-Nata AfIGF e tla felet a ka ditefelo t a fasana t a go fihlelela inthanete ka mo seleteng se ka gobane sephethephethe sa inthaneteng se tla dikologa gareng ga dinaga t a AfrikDikgatelopele t e di tla laet a bohlokwa bjo Afrika Borwa le AU di bonago go le bohlokwa go kgatha tema ga bohlokwa ka ekonoming ya inthanete e sego fela bjalo ka badiri
trg_text: The National Internet Governance Forum, and the Southern Africa Development Community Internet Exchange Point have been successfully launched by the Minister of Telecommunications and Postal Services, Dr Siyabonga Cwele and African Union (AU) Commissioner Dr Elham IbrahiThe National Internet Governance Forum (AfIGF) developed a country position, in preparation for the Fifth AfIGF from 16 to 18 October 2016, in eThekwini, KwaZulu-Nata The AfIGF will lead to lower costs to access the Internet in the region because the Internet traffic will circulate among African countrieThese developments underscore the importance that South Africa and the AU attach to meaningful participation in the Internet economy and not just as consumer These also take us closer to creating a more inclusive digital economy and knowledge society, as envisaged in the National Development Plan (NDP).

src_text: Se gape se re batamet a go go hloma ekonomi ya tit ithale ye e akaret ago bohle le set haba se se nago le tsebo, ka ge go hlagi it we ka go Leanotlhabollo la Boset haba (NDP).
trg_text: The Council for Scientific and Industrial Research on its new-generation fingerprint sensing technology that will better aid law-enforcement and forensic personnel in their wor The prototype device, funded by the Department of Science and Technology, can be used to scan areas and lift fingerprints without the use of dusting or the risk of contaminatio.

src_text: Mmu o o ikgafile go netefat a gore Inthanete e fihlelelwa ke maAfrika Borwa ka moka, e lego seo se tsenyago letsogo go go hlameng ga set haba seo se akaret ago bohl.
trg_text: Government is committed to ensuring that the Internet is universally accessible to all South Africans, which contributes to the creation of an inclusive societ.

src_text: Pont ho ya Theknolot i ya Difofane le ya Difofane t a Ma ole le Taet o ya t a Ma ole e swerwe ka katlego ke Kgoro ya T hirelet o, Armscor, Tirelo ya Difofane ya Afrika Borwa, Mokgatlo wa Intasteri ya Dinamelwa t a Meetseng le t a T hirelet o, Denel le Mokgatlo wa Phofi odifofane t a Kgwebo wa Afrika Borw Sefala se se dumelela diintasteri t a t hirelet o t a ka Afrika Borwa go bapat a bokgoni bja bona go set haba sa bodit habat haba, gomme mo ngwageng wo gape go bile le dipont ho t e mmalwa le diphabilione t a boset haba t e di emet wego ke dinaga t e di fapafapanego Maemo a Kabinete go Merero ye Bohlokwa Seemong sa Bjale Kabinete e kwana ka botlalo le polelo ye e filwego ke Kantoro ya Mopresidente ka la 23 Lewedi, ka ga taba ya Mohlankedimogolo wa Tshepedi o (COO) wa wa Lekgotlakga o la Afrika Borwa (SABC).
trg_text: The Africa Aerospace and Defence Air show and Defence Exhibition was successfully hosted by the Department of Defence, Armscor, SA Aerospace, Maritime and Defence Industry Association, Denel and the Commercial Aviation Association of South Afric This platform allowed South Africa s defence industries to market their capabilities to the international community, and this year also saw the largest number of exhibitors and national pavilions represented by various countries Cabinet s position on key issues in the environment Cabinet fully aligns itself with the statement issued by The Presidency on 23 September, on the matter of the Chief Operations Officer (COO) of the SAB Cabinet respects the ruling of the Supreme Court of Appeal (SCA) confirming the setting aside of the appointment of Mr Hlaudi Motsoeneng as COO of the SABCabinet calls on the SABC Board to abide by the letter and spirit of the SCA rulin Attempts to subvert the SCA ruling through legally suspect interpretations border on violating the constitutional principle of legality and challenge the constitutionally assigned judicial authority of our court The decision to reappoint Mr Motsoeneng in a new position shows disrespect of a rule of laCabinet reminded the Board of Section 165 of the Constitution: that an order or decision issued by a court binds all persons to whom and organs of state to which it applie Cabinet directed the Minister of Communications, Ms Faith Muthambi, to urgently take steps to address this matter with the SABC BoarCabinet welcomes the outcomes from South Africa s participation at the 71st United Nations General Assembly (UNGA), which was led by President Zum This took place from 20 to 26 September 2016 under the theme

src_text: Kabinete e hlompha kahlolo ye e dirilwego ke Kgorotsheko ya Godimo ya Boipelaet o (SCA) yeo e tii et ago gore go thwalwa ga Morena Hlaudi Motsoeneng bjalo ka COO ya SABC go beelwe thokKabinete e ipilet a go Lekgotlataolo la SABC go hlompha lengwalo le moya wa kahlolo ya SC Maitekelo a go nyat a kahlolo ya SCA ka go diri a ditlhathollo t a molao t a dikakanyo di sepelelana le go nyat a melawana ya molaotheo ya semolao le go hlohla dikgorotsheko t a rena t eo di romet wego ke molaotheo gore di phethagat e mola Sephetho sa go thwala leswa Morena Motsoeneng mo omong o moswa go bont ha go se hlomphe molaKabinete e gopodit e Lekgotla ka ga Karolo ya 165 ya Molaotheo: ye e bolelago gore taelo goba sephetho seo se t erwego ke kgorotsheko se tlama batho ka moka le Makala a mmu o ao a angwago ke sonKabinete e laet e Tona ya Dikgokagano, Mohumagadi Faith Muthambi, go t ea dikgato ka pela go rarolla taba ye le Lekgotla la SAB
trg_text: The Sustainable Development Goals: A universal push to transform our world .During this session world leaders adopted the New York Declaration which expresses the political will and commitment to protect the rights of refugees and migrant The commitments pave the way to negotiations aimed at an international conference and the adoption of a global compact for safe, orderly and regular migration in 2018.Our country once again reiterated its call for the strengthening of the institutions of global governance, including the UN, specifically the Security Council and advocated for the urgent reform of these institutions with the aim of correcting the historical injustice against Africa reflected in outdated structurePresident Zuma co-hosted with President Francois Hollande, of France the UN High-Level Commission on Health Employment and Economic Growth on 20 September 2016.

src_text: Kabinete e amogela dipoelo t a go kgatha tema ga Afrika Borwa ka go Kopanokgothekgothe ya bo 71 ya Mokgatlo wa Dinagakopano (UNGA), fao go bego go etilwe pele ke Mopresidente Zum Kopano ye e swerwe go thoma ka la 20 go fihla ka la 26 Lewedi 2016 ka fase ga morero wa
trg_text: from 15 to 16 October 2016 in Goa, IndiCabinet was also briefed on the status of operationalisation of the New Development Bank Africa Regional Centr South Africa will continue to support the coming into operation of the BRICS New Development Bank, which includes hosting the Africa Regional Centre in JohannesburThe established first BRICS financial institutions, such as the New Development Bank and Contingent Reserve Arrangement serve as catalytic institutions to leverage industrialisation and infrastructure programmes in South Africa and the continen Cabinet approved the South African negotiating mandate to serve as the basis for engagement at the 28th Meeting of the Parties to the Montreal Protocol on Substances that Deplete the Ozone Layer (Montreal MOP 28) to be held from 10 to 14 October 2016, in Kigali, Rwand The Montreal Protocol has been very effective in terms of phasing out Ozone Depleting Substance This links to our Constitution which provides that poverty reduction and socio-economic development should be advanced within the context of sustainable developmen The Third UN Conference on Housing and Sustainable Urbanisation (Habitat III) will be held by the UNGA in Quito, Ecuador from 17 to 20 October 2016.

src_text: irelet a ditokelo t a bafaladi le batho bao ba t wago dinageng t a ka ntl Boikgafo bjo bo loki edit e ditheri ano t eo di ikemi edit ego go swara khonferentshe ya bodit habat haba le go amogela ga kwano ya lefase ka bophara ya mabapi le go huduga fao go bolokegilego, ga toka le ga kgafet akgafet a ka 2018.Naga ya rena gape e bu eledit e boipilet o bja yona bja go maatlafat a ga dihlongwa t a pu o ya lefaseng ka bophara, go akaret wa Dinagakopano (UN), kudukudu Lekgotla la T hirelet o gomme ya t wet a pele peakanyoleswa ya dihlongwa t e ka maikemi et o a go pho olla tlhokego ya toka ya nakong ye e fetilego kgahlanong le Afrika yeo e bonaget ego ka go dibopego t e di fetilwego ke nakMopresidente Zuma le Mopresidente Francois Hollande, wa Fora e bile bo monggaemmogo ba Khomi ene ya Maemo a Godimo ya UN ka ga Go thwala Ba omi ba t a Maphelo le Kgolo ya Ekonomi ka la 20 Lewedi 2016.
trg_text: The primary objective is to ensure the formulation of required and implementable interventions towards greater economic inclusion for the secto Operation Phakisa: Agriculture and Land Reform seeks to create one million jobs, and plant one million hectares by 2019, as envisioned in the ND Cabinet approved the Capacity-building Strategic Framework for District and Local Municipalities in support of the Agri-parks Programm The Agri-parks Programme has become the cornerstone of government s priority to Revitalise Agriculture and Agro-processing Value Chain, which is one of the priorities of the Nine-Point Pla All 44 district municipalities have been included in this programm This will position Agri-parks to serve as an important mechanism to execute the NDP s proposed rural development strategy due to their potential for supporting small-scale agricultural production and stimulating agro-processing in rural area Cabinet also approved the National Integrated Information Communication Technology (ICT) Policy White Paper, which replaces the separate White Papers on Telecommunications (1996) and Postal Services (1998).This integrated ICT Policy outlines how government will ensure that the sector fulfils its potential to facilitate inclusive social and economic transformation in South Afric The Minister of Telecommunications and Postal Services, Dr Cwele, will convene a separate media briefing to further unpack this polic Cabinet approved the submission of the African Telecommunications Union (ATU) Convention of 1999 to Parliament for ratification in terms of Section 231(2) of the ConstitutioThe ATU is an organ that promotes universal access in Africa and the use of ICTs

src_text: Khomi ene ye e hlomilwe ke Mongwaledipharephare wa UN gomme maikemi et o a yona ke go reri ana le baetapele maemong a godimodimo go hlohlelet a go hlongwa ga dibaka t e diswa t a me omo ka lefapheng la t a maphelo lefaseng ka bophar Pego ya Khomi ene yeo e amoget wego ke Kopanokgothekgothe, e dira dit hi inyo go Dinagamaloko, go thoma ka dinyakwa t a tlhahlo, thuto ye e t welago pele le tlhokego ya go lebelela kudu go tlhokomelo ya maphelo ya mothe Se se akaret a boikgafo bja go hlahla ba omi ba t a maphelo ba dimilione t e 40 go fihla ka ngwaga wa 2030.Go gafelwa semmu o ga maemo a boetapele bja Selekane le Mmu o sa go Hloka Sephiri (OGP) go dirilwe ke Mopresidente Zuma ka tiragalong ya segopot o sa mengwaga ye mehlano ka fase ga UNG Ka nakong ya ge Afrika Borwa e le modulasetulo wa OGP re etile pele Kwano ya Mmu o ya go Hloka Sephiri ka ga go tsenywa tiri ong ga Lenaneo la 2030 la Tlhabollo ya go ya Go ile, yeo e tlago dira gore dinagamaloko t a OGP di tsenye Dinepo t a Tlhabollo ya go ya Go ile ka go maanotiro a OGP a dinaga t a t on Afrika Borwa le yona e beile pele go hloka sephiri ga peyo ya melao, tshedimo o ya pepeneneng, le go kgathatema ga set haba sa badudi fao go phatlalet ego go akaret a go hloma mekgatlo ya badudi le ya dihlopha t e di lego kotsing ka gare ga OGP Diphetho t e Bohlokwa t a Kabinete Kabinete e sedimo it we ka ga tshekatsheko ya Sekolo sa t a Mahlale sa Afrika Borwa ka ga go itoki et a ga Afrika Borwa go t a sethekniki go thekga intasteri ya gase ya go nt hwa maswikeng, go akaret wa dit hi inyo ka ga ditiro t eo di tlago tsenywa tiri ong ke dikgoro t a malebKa phetogelong go ditheknolot i t a khapone ya fase mola ka go le lengwe re kaonafat a t hirelet o ya enet i, Afrika Borwa e bona gase ya go nt hwa masikweng bjalo ka selo seo se ka tsenyago letsogo go kabo ya ka moso ya enet Pego, yeo e tlago lokollwa gore e fiwe set haba, e hlagi a merero ye mmalwa yeo e nyakago
trg_text: It aims to adopt a New Urban Agenda; an action-oriented document which will set global standards of achievement in sustainable urban development, rethinking the way we build, manage, and live in cities through drawing together cooperation with committed partners, relevant stakeholders, and urban actors at all levels of government as well as the private secto The International Conferences on Research Infrastructures (ICRI 2016) will be hosted in Cape Town from 3 to 5 October 2016 by the Department of Science and Technology and the European CommissioThe conference aims to highlight the essential role of global research infrastructures in addressing grand challenges and as hubs for innovation; reflecting on needs, development and sustainability of global/regional research infrastructures; and discussing the possibility to move towards an international roadmaSouth Africa has demonstrated its science and technology research capability, and is acknowledged as a natural home of some of the world's most significant research infrastructure The hosting of ICRI 2016 will augment the country's progression to becoming a knowledge-based economy as envisaged in the ND Cabinet welcomes the announcement of the first phase milestone towards switching-off of the analogue transmitter on 28 October 2016 by Communications Minister Faith Muthambi, in the core towns of the Square Kilometre Array (SKA) areas in the Northern Cape, in the town of Carnavon within the Kareeberg Local Municipalit Over 86% of households in the SKA areas have been connected and are enjoying digital terrestrial television services in their homeThe migration is also in line with the NDP to create a robust, reliable, secure and affordable ICT infrastructur It will connect rural and urban, rich and poor ensuring that South African citizens transact and communicate more effectively with the use of technolog Government will celebrate Social Development Month in October under the theme
